intro: Oryctanthus florulentus, commonly known as the firecracker flower, is a striking plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique flower structure attracts pollinators such as bees and birds, contributing to its ecological role. Oryctanthus florulentus is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and landscapes.
